alfredsnippet.snippet:
The reporting on the Martian dust storms by conventional sources has left out crucial details. In particular ...

(1) The Martian dust devils appear to sometimes exhibit electrical discharges at the point of contact with the ground. The dark spots which trail them might not simply be the exposure of ground beneath the red dust; it is possible that the dust devils are also scorching the ground ...

https://www.thunderbolts.info/tpod/2005/arch05/050721dustdevils.htm

... and ...

(2) I mention that because the global dust storms exhibit filamentation throughout. Close-up shots reveal that the dust storms are literally millions of filaments, side-by-side.  The imagery is clear on this point ...

http://www.thunderbolts.info/tpod/2007/arch07/070509dustdevils.htm

Given that the Martian atmospheric pressure is only 1% of the Earth's, can a thermo-mechanical model really explain the observations?
